body:
Perhaps its the unique directory change: https://docs.gradle.org/3.0/release-notes#unique-default-test-result-and-report-directories-for-test-tasks

Adding that you can revert to the old behavior with:

```
test.reports.html.destination = testReportDir // build/reports/tests
test.reports.xml.destination = testResultDir // build/test-results
```
Review by @junrao
@ewencp I addressed your comment.
LGTM, thanks!
@ijuma This LGTM assuming we sort out the Jenkins integration issue.
Ping @junrao
+1 as well after jenkins integration fix.

The build passed after I made a slight change to the Jenkins job configuration:

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/5226/testReport/

The change was from `**/build/test-results/*.xml` to `**/build/test-results/**.xml`. If people are happy with this, I'll change all trunk jobs and merge this PR.
@ijuma Makes sense to me.
Merged to trunk. For the 0.10.0 branch, we may want to remove the `scalaCompileOptions.useAnt = false` line only.
@ijuma Sounds like a good idea since I upgraded Gradle to test this and can no longer build the 0.10.0 branch. Oops. I think you need the scoverage change too.
Thanks @junrao comments addressed

Trying to contain exceptions in `WorkerConnector` or `WorkerTask` proved to be a very complicated refactoring, as a lot of early work needed to be delayed into their `initialize()` methods. I instead went with containing exceptions in the `Worker` (#1778) as suggested by @hachikuji and @ewencp.
Closing this PR and creating a new one as I made a mistake somewhere in the process of rebasing.
This is currently a commit on top of the PR in KAFKA-3799 (https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1483) I will rebase after that PR is integrated.
@ewencp, this is the 0.10.0 backport as per the discussion in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1774
Thanks @junrao. Addressed comments

@ewencp for review

Jenkins fail is around uploading test report, Connect system tests pass with branch builder
LGTM
@ijuma Merged, I think you need to close this since it is against 0.10.0.
Yes, thanks!
@gwenshap would you be able to take a look at this trivial doc improvement.
The test failure is not related. @gwenshap @harshach does this look ok now?

Thanks for the patch. Could you fix the following test failure? Otherwise, LGTM.

:clients:checkstyleTest[ant:checkstyle] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/clients/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/common/config/ConfigDefTest.java:138:73: ',' is not followed by whitespace.
 FAILED

@ijuma 
updated per comments and included an initial cut at including a bash script.
rebased this PR
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.

would be good if @junrao takes a look too, but it seems like a straightforward refactoring so LGTM.

Love the cleanup, as always :)
Thanks @junrao. Fixed the checkstyle breakage
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@ijuma @guozhangwang
Redirecting to PR #1787
Review by @junrao, cc @edenhill
LGTM, this way we can fix the test without pressure.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
@ewencp @hachikuji addressed review comments
Thanks for the review Gwen, since this is simply moving methods around (like you said), I don't think we need to wait for Jun. Will merge to trunk.
LGTM. Thank you for contributing.
LGTM. Thanks for adding this.
LGTM. This should help some in debugging :)
LGTM.

Nice catch :) Would be good if @junrao could take a look, as I'm not an expert on that code, but looks like an important fix to me.

Left minor style comments.

LGTM.  Thanks for fixing this!
FYI: @ewencp

@granthenke, what was decision here?
If you decided not to proceed, feel free to close the PR :)
LGTM. Thank you for fixing this.
LGTM. I could have sworn I've fixed this before... Thank you!

I tried to re-run the unit tests locally and seems the following three test cases fail frequently:

```
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest > testInnerKTableKTable FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: Condition not met within timeout 300000. Did not receive 1 number of records
        at org.apache.kafka.test.TestUtils.waitForCondition(TestUtils.java:256)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.utils.IntegrationTestUtils.waitUntilMinValuesRecordsReceived(IntegrationTestUtils.java:245)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest.checkResult(JoinIntegrationTest.java:169)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest.runTest(JoinIntegrationTest.java:196)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest.testInnerKTableKTable(JoinIntegrationTest.java:366)

org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest > testLeftKTableKTable FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: Condition not met within timeout 300000. Did not receive 1 number of records
        at org.apache.kafka.test.TestUtils.waitForCondition(TestUtils.java:256)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.utils.IntegrationTestUtils.waitUntilMinValuesRecordsReceived(IntegrationTestUtils.java:245)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest.checkResult(JoinIntegrationTest.java:169)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest.runTest(JoinIntegrationTest.java:196)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.JoinIntegrationTest.testLeftKTableKTable(JoinIntegrationTest.java:393)

org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.internals.KTableKTableLeftJoinTest > testNotSendingOldValue FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError
        at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
        at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
        at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
        at org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.internals.KTableKTableLeftJoinTest.testNotSendingOldValue(KTableKTableLeftJoinTest.java:181)
```
please review: @guozhangwang @enothereska
Thanks @gwenshap!
LGTM! Jenkins failure is not relevant.
Merged into both trunk and 0.10.0.
Also ping @HenryCaiHaiying who filed this JIRA to review.
Great job cleaning this up! Aside from the minor issues around `WorkerUtil`, this LGTM.

this makes sense, but there are merge conflicts... can you rebase?

Also, can @ijuma or @granthenke confirm this makes sense?

The changes LGTM. We have an integration test (InternalTopicIntegrationTest) that checks whether changelogs are compacted. Does it make sense to add another check there for windowed changelogs to see if they are compacted and deleted? Thanks.

@gwenshap This makes sense to me. We discussed it on @ijuma's recent Gradle 3.0 PR here: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1774#issuecomment-241757166

I think it has lasted so long because people are unsure why it still exists in the first place.
What's the difference between COMPACT_AND_DELETE and COMPACT?
Thanks @hachikuji, made `WorkerUtil` into `ConnectorFactory` (sorry @ewencp) in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1778/commits/acfb4fb154dc56beb14b2ef485f7dcaa239e78f5
Thanks @mfenniak ! This is a great catch.
LGTM and merged to trunk.
Thanks for the merge, @guozhangwang!

LGTM, and checked tests locally since Jenkins failed with some weird error that looks like an issue with the jenkins build slave. There is one unused import checkstyle fix but I'll just clean that up during commit.
@kkonstantine Had some comments, but overall the approach looks good.

@HenryCaiHaiying we added the ability to run compact and delete policies together in [KIP-71](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-71%3A+Enable+log+compaction+and+deletion+to+co-exist)

Compaction_And_Delete is what we want for window store, thanks for the
change.

@guozhangwang @ijuma 
5 runs passed. It seems the fix works for `0.10.0`. I guess this can get merged. Still need for figure out something for `trunk` though.
@cotedm Your changes look good to me. I'm wondering if this change can be merged without a warning to users who are using the console producer with the existing default ack.
@mjsax When you got time, could you do some profiling on the inner join integration test to see what is the performance bottleneck? This latency is surprising and may indicate some bugs AFAIK.

@vahidhashemian I think a warning is not important here because the console producer is not intended to be a performant production producer in the first place.  The change should be documented in the release notes, but I would say there won't be any users that notice the change in a negative way.
@cotedm Yeah, seems reasonable to me. I was even wondering if we should even assume the print option is desired if _any_ decoder is explicitly specified. What do you think?
@cotedm That is what I assumed too. Thanks. LGTM.
@hachikuji yeah that makes sense.  I've updated the PR accordingly and fixed some punctuation issues with the usage output.
LGTM

Comments have been addressed. The PR has been rebased on top of the recent changes from KAFKA-4042. @shikhar please also check that the changes are inline with the spirit of your changes. 

The responsibility of starting and stopping connectors and tasks en mass has remained in the distributed herder (that's a requirement mainly for the start operations, but to make this symmetric, it was applied to stop operations as well).
cc @ewencp for review

@shikhar Change looks good. Test? Also, technically we have `SchemaBuilder` implement `Schema` as well, so you could potentially run into similar issues with that class if no fields had been added. In fact, you could probably fix both just by fixing the same issue in `SchemaBuilder`'s constructor since then the empty field list would be carried over to `ConnectSchema`'s constructor.
thanks @ewencp, addressed comment
LGTM

@guozhangwang I've pushed some updates based on what has been discussed above. Please take a look (and also at my other comments above). 
Thanks

It's not clear to me why we are deprecating the old consumer option since the old consumer itself is not deprecated yet. It seems appealing to deprecate both at the same time and the old consumer won't be deprecated until after 0.10.1.0. I don't feel strongly either way though.

We had a recent discussion in the mailing list about removing the beta label from the new consumer and people were in favour. As such, it would be great to include this PR in the next release. The minimum set of changes IMO are:
1. Make the new consumer the default as long as `--zookeeper` is not specified
2. Fail with an error if `--zookeeper` and `--new-consumer` are specified at the same time
3. Support the `--new-consumer` option for compatibility
4. Update usages of the tools in the docs to use the new consumer
5. Add a note in upgrade.html

I am not sure if we should support `--old-consumer`. The main reason would be to be consistent with the console producer, but probably not worth it.

@arunmahadevan, can you please rebase the PR?
Obsolete. Will create new PR for KIP-74
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
@hachikuji I removed the WIP label from the PR. It would be great if you could take a look and share your feedback. Thanks.
@nepal as we are trying to coordinate this PR with replication quotas PR, it would be helpful to understand when you will be able to post a PR for this one. What's your current estimate?
Ah yep, makes sense, I've cleaned those up now I believe
Merged to 10.0.0, leaving the JIRA open until #1767 is closed. @mjsax please feel free to close this PR.
LGTM. Maybe we can cajole @ewencp into reviewing.

Build passed: https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-git-pr-jdk7/5342/
Going to trigger a new one.
@junrao could you please take a look at this new PR (I closed the prior one). I switched to using the time index to determine the last message time in the LogSegments as we discussed.

@hachikuji @cotedm Consider me cajoled. This all LGTM, and thanks for doing the other cleanup along the way.

I'm going to merge this, but it did also turn up https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4103 in the process of my testing. @hachikuji you'll definitely want to look at that issue.
@ewencp Thanks for the pointer. Most likely screwed something up with the new version I introduced in KIP-62.
